merged_from.product_title_rule: keep base product_line when matched; do not edit titles (amazon titles are lower quality)
merged_from.brand_rule: choose more descriptive (letters+digits beats letters-only or digits-only; else longer)
merged_from.shade_rule_for_trumping: compare deterministic shade groups (num+name order-insensitive; descriptor-only collapsed) to determine Ulta uniqueness; no fuzzy shades
merged_from.shade_display_rule: for overlapping shades, keep more comprehensive display (alpha+digit preferred) even if Ulta adds no new shade groups
merged_from.amazon_extra_rule: filter obvious non-shade noise in Amazon before merging; no fuzzy shade matching

shade_format_rule: Code/number-first normalization: (1) If shade ends with a code token like 'Skye ST0.5', 'Porcelain 1W1', or 'Praline 10N', move code to front => 'ST0.5 Skye', '1W1 Porcelain', '10N Praline'. Codes are normalized (uppercase prefix, remove stray dot; ST also drops leading zeros like ST01->ST1). (2) If shade begins with a code token, normalize its formatting (e.g., 'st.5 Skye' -> 'ST0.5 Skye'). (3) Otherwise, if shade contains a standalone numeric token not first (e.g., 'Buff Beige 130'), move that number to the front.
